Key Match Events: Nikola Jovic made a game-winning layup and foul shot with 7.8 seconds left to give the Heat a 95-94 win.
Jaden McDaniels scored a putback with nine seconds left to give the Timberwolves the lead before Jovic's decisive play.
Pre-Game Insights: The Heat played without Jimmy Butler, who was out due to an illness.
The Timberwolves struggled from the three-point line initially, shooting 3-for-15.
Post-Match Reflections: Heat coach Erik Spoelstra's strategy was highlighted as key to the victory.
The Timberwolves' Naz Reid hit a crucial three-pointer to give them a 64-63 lead, their first since early in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Heat set a season-high with 14 steals and nine blocks, disrupting the Timberwolves' offense.
The Timberwolves had 20 turnovers but managed 16 offensive rebounds, six by Rudy Gobert.
